page.title: 01OLD BARONY OF RUSKIE
page.content: Northern area of this block dominated by south facing fertile slopes - mostly family sized mixed farms, now freehold but previously estate tenants. Brown sandy soils (lower Red sandstone outcrop) are height 150 ft. Typical Scottish enclosed landscape - square fields, many stone dykes (walls) but now barbed wire and nets. Small woodlands, including Roundels, from Enclosure Acts. Ditched and drained fields, many burns. Traditional farm steadings, square close with farmhouse facing south. Southern area mostly corse land - flaviel silty/clay over sandstone, are height 20 ft. Greater area is peat moss, much planted with Sitka by Forestry Commission. Rest climax vegetation, great wildlife reserve unofficial. Corse forms flat well known for producing hay.
